product_name: LancomeTeint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation Stick
summary: SummaryLanc√¥me's Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation Stick is an up to 24 hour wear, full coverage, oil-free, multitasking foundation stick with a built-in kabuki brush.
details: DetailsFeaturesBest-selling Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation is a 5-IN-1 multitasking, on-the-go format with a built-in kabuki brush to conceal, contour, cover, highlight and blend anywhere and anytimeThe lightweight, silky texture applies seamlessly and blends effortlessly into skin for a "second skin" feelBenefits32 hour wearFull coverageOil-freeMultitasking foundation stick with a built-in kabuki brushTransfer-resistant cream to powder formula provides a natural matte finish and controls shine all-dayResearch ResultsClinical Results in a consumer test realized on 101 women:95% agreed it felt comfortable on the skin95% say appearance of imperfections is minimized94% agreed it provides a shine-free finish92% say it minimizes the appearance of poresItem 2577708How To UseTo Apply: After cleansing facial skin, apply face primer. Lanc√¥me suggests using La Base Pro, which blurs the appearance of pores, fine lines, wrinkles and other skin imperfections for a flawless foundation application. Apply Teint Id√¥le Ultra Wear Foundation Stick onto skin and build for custom foundation makeup coverage. Blend using the built-in kabuki brush.To Conceal: Choose a foundation shade 1-2 intensities lighter than your skin tone. Dab Teint Id√¥le Ultra Wear Foundation Stick to "spot correct" under eye dark circles, redness, blemishes and other imperfections.To Contour: Choose a foundation shade 2-3 shades darker than your skin tone. A cool shade is recommended. Contour as needed - under cheekbones, across jawline, along forehead and sides of the nose to sculpt desired features.To Cover: Choose a foundation shade that matches your skin tone. Dab foundation starting at the center of the forehead, cheeks, center of face and chin. Start with less and add more in areas that you desire extra coverage.To Highlight: Choose a foundation shade 1-2 intensities lighter than your skin tone. Apply down the center of the nose, on the upper cheek bones, cupid's bow, the center of the chin or other desired areas for a matte, non-shimmer highlight effect.To Blend: Blend your custom coverage easily, quickly and flawlessly with Teint Id√¥le Ultra Wear Foundation Stick's built-in kabuki brush. Blend in a circular, outward motion for even application and natural looking full coverage foundation.Pro Tip: Pair Teint Id√¥le Ultra Wear Liquid Foundation with Teint Id√¥le Ultra Wear 5-in-1 Foundation Stick. Start by applying the liquid foundation for all over coverage. Use the 5-in-1 foundation stick to spot correct, conceal, contour, bronze, and highlight.IngredientsActive: Octinoxate 2.0 %, Titanium Dioxide 1.94%. Inactive: Cyclohexasiloxane, Phenyl Trimethicone, Isohexadecane, Polyethylene, Methyl Methacrylate Crosspolymer, Aluminum Calcium Sodium Silicate, Cyclopentasiloxane, Arachidyl Propionate, Tambourissa Trichophylla Leaf Extract, Perlite, Aluminum Hydroxide, Disodium Stearoyl Glutamate, Isopropyl Titanium Triisostearate, Lauroyl Lysine. May Contain: Mica, Titanium Dioxide, Iron Oxides, Ferric Ammonium Ferrocyanide.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: To Apply: After cleansing facial skin, apply face primer. Lanc√¥me suggests using La Base Pro, which blurs the appearance of pores, fine lines, wrinkles and other skin imperfections for a flawless foundation application. Apply Teint Id√¥le Ultra Wear Foundation Stick onto skin and build for custom foundation makeup coverage. Blend using the built-in kabuki brush.To Conceal: Choose a foundation shade 1-2 intensities lighter than your skin tone. Dab Teint Id√¥le Ultra Wear Foundation Stick to "spot correct" under eye dark circles, redness, blemishes and other imperfections.To Contour: Choose a foundation shade 2-3 shades darker than your skin tone. A cool shade is recommended. Contour as needed - under cheekbones, across jawline, along forehead and sides of the nose to sculpt desired features.To Cover: Choose a foundation shade that matches your skin tone. Dab foundation starting at the center of the forehead, cheeks, center of face and chin. Start with less and add more in areas that you desire extra coverage.To Highlight: Choose a foundation shade 1-2 intensities lighter than your skin tone. Apply down the center of the nose, on the upper cheek bones, cupid's bow, the center of the chin or other desired areas for a matte, non-shimmer highlight effect.To Blend: Blend your custom coverage easily, quickly and flawlessly with Teint Id√¥le Ultra Wear Foundation Stick's built-in kabuki brush. Blend in a circular, outward motion for even application and natural looking full coverage foundation.Pro Tip: Pair Teint Id√¥le Ultra Wear Liquid Foundation with Teint Id√¥le Ultra Wear 5-in-1 Foundation Stick. Start by applying the liquid foundation for all over coverage. Use the 5-in-1 foundation stick to spot correct, conceal, contour, bronze, and highlight.

reviews.headline: For my sensitive skin!!!
reviews.comments:
Perfection, beautiful color blended well light or full coverage can do all. 
Does not break me out with every penny. My confidence has been boosted since wearing this and can't pull myself to even try anything else. I'm IN love

reviews.headline: Very smooth going on!
reviews.comments: I love the product, but do wish it wasn't so expensive.  I will buy it until I can find something cheaper, or if it ever goes on sale.

reviews.headline: Works for Me
reviews.comments: This foundation stick is really helpful when you need a little extra coverage.

reviews.headline: No
reviews.comments: First of all, compare the two pictures of 110C and 140N. Obviously, 140N is whiter, and there is no explanation on the picture that the cream is pink. After I got it, I was so disappointed. I have yellow skin and whiter. I can only say that this foundation is not even whiter than my skin tone, and the cream is pink. The face will turn gray, not to mention that people with fair skin buy it. It has no effect at all. Why can't the minimum color number be marked clearly? Why do consumers have to waste time to return the goods when they get the wrong information? I will never buy it again.

reviews.headline: Go to the store to try it before buying itÔºÅÔºÅÔºÅ
reviews.comments: First of all, compare the two pictures of 110C and 140N. Obviously, 140N is whiter, and there is no explanation on the picture that the cream is pink. After I got it, I was so disappointed. I have yellow skin and whiter. I can only say that this foundation is not even whiter than my skin tone, and the cream is pink. The face will turn gray, not to mention that people with fair skin buy it. It has no effect at all. Why can't the minimum color number be marked clearly? Why do consumers have to waste time to return the goods when they get the wrong information? I will never buy this brand again.

reviews.headline: It's OK
reviews.comments: I feel it's over priced for what you get. It looks like the stick has melted even though it's been in my house for over a week. The makeup stick also breaks very easy. I wouldn't buy it again

reviews.headline: Love the formula, hate the shades
reviews.comments:
I love the coverage, feel and finish of this stick foundation for summer when I need some coverage without looking like I'm wearing foundation. I have normal skin and didn't experience any creasing, transfer or caking with this foundation. It would be absolutely perfect of not for the poor shade range and terrible packaging.

230 is the lightest yellow-toned shade and although I can make it work in summer with some bronzer and highlighting, it's actually a full shade darker than my natural skintone and I'm not even super pale. The brush end is also useless and a waste of packaging. For the price, I would rather have more foundation and no brush end.

reviews.headline: So smooth!!
reviews.comments: I wanted a stick foundation bc that's what I was used to. When I was introduced to this, I love it!! It goes on so smooth, stays on and doesn't get oily. I have been getting it now for about 6 months.

reviews.headline: My best foundation
reviews.comments: I have used a ton of foundations through the years and they were wrong color or too greasy to cakey et etc.  This is as close to perfect as I have found.  Just make a few swipes around face, blend and you are done. I don't even use a concealer or powder.   I am slightly oily and have wrinkles.  The best I have found.

reviews.headline: Great foundation
reviews.comments: I never thought I would find a foundation that would make my older wrinkled and textured combo skin look better not worse.  I had just about given up on foundation.  It is very easy to use and best color match.   It is pricey but worth it.   It also takes the place of concealer.

reviews.headline: My favorite foundation
reviews.comments: My favorite foundation but you don't get enough for the price!  The foundation really covers and goes on nicely.  I'm only giving this 3 stars because it's just too expensive for the amount of product you get. I go through this very fast!

reviews.headline: I have oily sensitive skin and wouldn't recommend
reviews.comments: If your skin is any less smooth than glass, it will fill every pore like spackling on a wall and highlight all texture. Although it blends smoothly on smooth areas, you can see every iota of texture and every pore that the product settles into.

reviews.headline: Not worth the price
reviews.comments: I though because of the brand and price it would be something i would be coming back for. But i liked nothing about this product including how it looked on skin, how it felt on the skin, how it blended, the brush that it comes with is almost worthless. I wouldnt hate this product if i didnt spend so much for what its worth.

reviews.headline: Not worth the price
reviews.comments: I though because of the brand and price it would be something i would be coming back for. But i liked nothing about this product including how it looked on skin, how it felt on the skin, how it blended, the brush that it comes with is almost worthless. I wouldnt hate this product if i didnt spend so much for what its worth.

reviews.headline: Perfect foundation
reviews.comments: Love this foundation

reviews.headline: This is a go to favorite foundation!
reviews.comments: Nice, light foundation. Doesn't feel heavy on my skin.

reviews.headline: Great foundation!
reviews.comments: I love it. It was my first try for a stick foundation. Good coverage. But if youre a everyday makeup person at least for me it didnt last a year i think overall i had it for 4-5 months lol. So its good if you dont often need a lot to use

reviews.headline: I'll never buy another foundation
reviews.comments: It's expensive but worth it. I wear it everywhere, to work as a nurse and beyond. Its the perfect amount of matte/satin finish. I have dry flaky skin and occasional acne. Under it I wear estee advanced night repair serum, peptide eye cream, cocokind electrolyte cream, gel sunscreen, and loreal lumi glotion. Love the brush. Worried about keeping it hygienic but thinking an occasional dainty wash or spraying alcohol on it will suffice

reviews.headline: My favorite Lancome product!
reviews.comments: So soft and creamy and perfect for light make up days, or to cover spots.

reviews.headline: Love the formula, HATE the packaging!
reviews.comments:
I really want to love this foundation!  The foundation itself is great!  The brush is ridiculous!  It's too tapered to blur well and too stiff to blend around eyes and nose.  The cap for the brush end doesn't stay on either.  It's very annoying!  Also when you wind up the stick to apply, it doesn't lock in place.  It instantly rolls back down.  It is so weird‚Äîmaybe I just got a bad one‚Ä¶?

But if I were to rate on the foundation, I would give it a solid 4 maybe even 5 stars.  It goes on easily, the color matches perfectly and stays put all day!  I've been using it alternatively with dior and merit stick foundations to see which I like best and the Lancome would probably win if it wasn't for the poor packaging!

media.caption: I'm the 1 with the hair!! 70 and such a beautiful makeup!!

media.caption: Always makeup perfect with teint idole in your bag

media.caption: Nice natural look!

media.caption: Flawless coverage

media.headline: The packaging is a waste!  But content is terrific!
media.caption: Look how much is hidden in the bottom of the tube!!!

media.headline: The easiest makeup I've ever used
media.caption: At least my eyebrows are evenish

faceoff_positive.comments: I love this foundation stick so much! Great coverage, finish and color match for my combo/oily skin. I used to wear concealer as foundation. Not anymore! I absolutely adore this formula. Ditch the brush at the end. Too bulky. Add more product for the price. Make this formula forever!!
faceoff_positive.headline: BEST EVER! PLZ do NOT discontinue!!

faceoff_negative.comments: I too am sad and disappointed that Lancome has reformulated the Teint Idole Foundation Stick to remove the SPF and change the shades so that they no longer correspond to the Teint Idole liquid foundation.  I have used the liquid foundation for many years in 220 Buff Cool; and was a fan of the old foundation stick in 220 Buff Cool as well.  My complexion looks best with a cool shade; 220 Buff Neutral in the new stick is a totally different color.  I have used Lancome products for over 30 years and it seems that they are constantly changing products that I have come to enjoy and rely on.  Please stop!!
faceoff_negative.headline: Stop Messing with Winning Products

rollup.name: Teint Id√¥le Ultra Wear Foundation Stick
